H0.text: Heat is the process that caused the stalactites to form in Natural Bridge Caverns that students observed during their class field trip.

H1.text: Pressure is the process that caused stalactites to form, as observed by students on a field trip to Natural Bridge Caverns.

H2.text: Freezing is the process that caused the stalactites observed by the students on their class field trip to Natural Bridge Caverns to form.

H3.text: Deposition is the process that caused the stalactites to form in the Natural Bridge Caverns that students observed during their class field trip.

A4.text: They form through deposition of calcium carbonate and other minerals, which is precipitated from mineralized water solutions.

A5.text: When the solution comes into contact with air the chemical reaction that created it is reversed and particles of calcium carbonate are deposited.
